page.title: 14POLICE PROTECT STONEHENGE
page.content: During June of this year, the 'Rights of Way' in our area were some of the best protected in the whole country. For over 3,000 police, drawn from forces all over the country, guarded every possible entry to Stonehenge, pathways and tracks were blocked by huge tree stumps or farm machinery, and access was refused in order to stop pop fans getting onto the site. Local farmers, who normally maintain the footpaths for ramblers, willingly co-operated with the Police to stop people camping on farmland and every possible entry point was guarded. All main roads were bollarded off into single line traffic, vehicles were visually checked. Police Transit Vans with radio control acted as a back up, and anything suspicious was stopped. Many arrests were made for motoring or drug offences.
